alert.note: Alert for Calhoun; Doddridge; Gilmer; Harrison; Jackson; Lewis; Mason; Ritchie; Roane; Wirt; Wood (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 01 at 9:52PM EST by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 230 AM EST SUNDAY... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Portions of southeast Ohio and West Virginia, including the following counties, in southeast Ohio, Meigs. In West Virginia, Calhoun, Doddridge, Gilmer, Harrison, Jackson, Lewis, Mason, Ritchie, Roane, Wirt and Wood. * WHEN...Until 230 AM EST. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is occurring. Streams continue to rise due to excess runoff from earlier rainfall. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 947 PM EST, Several reports of high water on roads have been received. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Clarksburg, Ripley, Spencer, Harrisville, Pomeroy, Elizabeth, Racine, Grantsville, Ravenswood, Pennsboro, Lumberport, West Union, Mineralwells, and Jackson Mill. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Please report Severe Weather to the National Weather Service by calling toll free, 800 401 9535, when you can do so safely. You may also report severe weather by posting your report to the Charleston West Virginia National Weather Service Facebook Page, or by using the Twitter Hashtag, NWSRLX.

area.areaDesc: Calhoun; Doddridge; Gilmer; Harrison; Jackson; Lewis; Mason; Ritchie; Roane; Wirt; Wood
